text: Does `ForwardDiff` work with `Python` functions? posted this question here <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/does-forwarddiff-work-with-python-functions/57851>

From the documentation of FD you find that
<https://juliadiff.org/ForwardDiff.jl/stable/user/limitations/>

```The target function can only be composed of generic Julia functions```
Numpy is naturally not a generic Julia function to it won’t work (it is expecting numpy types such as Floats and it won’t work with the `Dual` numbers required for FD)

text: Why would you even use Numpy? If you want to differentiate Python code look into `autograd`, but that’s beyond the scope of this slack channel
